I'm not sure who the original poster is, but here are some recommendations.

1. Kent Beck, "Test-Driven Development by Example"
2. Vincent Massol, Ted Husted, "JUnit in Action" coming soon
3. "JUnit Cookbook" by some guys who frequent this mailing list, coming late 2003/early 2004

Books for JUnit are just now bursting onto the scene because, to this point, the collective wisdom of JUnit has been maintained on the web. There are at least 10 books worth of great information on the web, but if you want books, you're getting them. Just be patient.

Take care.
